stories.text:
Why doesn't Hedera's hashgraph DLT get more attention?

Though not a blockchain, its claims seem like the answer to the scalability trilemma.

Curious what you brilliant folks think of it.
stories.title: Thoughts on Hedera's Hashgraph DLT?

stories.text:
My main computing device is a Lenovo x220 with xubuntu. It does 99% of what I need; I love it.

I also own a 2021 Ipad Pro. I bought it as a Nomad Sculpt and Procreate machine. However, I've really been getting into graphics programming lately and would love to start building my own custom tools and augmented reality graphics sketches. I'm specifically interested in getting some experience in with the Metal API.

Unfortunately, I don't have $2k or even $500 to drop on an apple compute device. I have an old, very beat up 2010 MBP, but I don't know how much use it would be. I certainly wouldn't want to develop on it.

Are there any reasonably priced services that I could use to compile apps for IpadOS? It seems like in this day and age I ought to be able to write the whole thing on my preferred xubuntu machine, then send that over to something else for "apple-compliant-compilation" and so on and so forth.
stories.title: Can I make graphics-intensive IpadOS apps without a mac?
Red, Blue and Yellow are not the primary colors
